intro: Norantea macroscypha, commonly known as the giant leaf fern, is a striking tropical plant characterized by its large, leathery fronds that can grow up to several meters in length. It belongs to the family Polypodiaceae and is native to the rainforests of Southeast Asia. The plant features a rhizomatous growth habit, with its roots anchoring it to moist, shaded environments. Its fronds are typically bioluminescent under certain conditions, adding to its unique botanical appeal. Norantea macroscypha thrives in high humidity and requires consistent moisture to maintain its lush, vibrant appearance.
